item.title: ::noclip owner only?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Marine5287, post:4, topic:396225”]Just so you know, commands aren’t client sided.[/quote]you can have client side commands. I have a setlevel, item, etc.

item.title: ::noclip owner only?
item.dc:creator: @Infernal_Pure Infernal Pure
item.description:
@Infernal_Pure wrote:

No, you’re right. But no-clip is. That’s why Cheat Clients are able to do it, because most people have no-clip client sided.

Read full topic

item.title: ::noclip owner only?
item.dc:creator: @Infernal_Pure Infernal Pure
item.description:
@Infernal_Pure wrote:

I don’t see what you’re getting at, I’ve never had a compiling error with commands, let alone noclip… I can’t see where it would be wrong! But, in any case, here is my no-clip command.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("noclip") && c.playerRights >= 3) { c.sendMessage("No-Clip Activated.!");

This is also for 562 loading 602. I don’t know what Deob you’re using.

Hope I helped!

Read full topic

item.title: ::noclip owner only?
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

[quote=“pastaway, post:1, topic:396225”]i know this is client sided but was hopin somebody knew fix here
my noclip command anybody can use and i tried adding && (c.playerRights == 3)) to it… didnt work, just got erros… anybody know fix?

[quote]
if(inputString.equals("::noclip"))
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++) {
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++) {
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;
}
}[/quote][/quote]

if(command.startsWith(“noclip”) && playerRights < 3){
disconnected = true;
}

if you disconnect when you type ::noclip it goes awy till you typed it again. Only fix for it i know

Read full topic
